#summary Export data to standard output formats

= Introduction =

Access offers many export capabilities to Excel or as plain text files. You can refer the Microsoft Office help articles for detailed instructions:

 * [http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/access-help/export-data-to-excel-HA001224122.aspx Access 2007+ to Excel]
 * [http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/access-help/import-export-and-link-data-between-access-and-excel-HP001095095.aspx?CTT=1 Access 2003 (and similarly in older versions) to Excel]

= The quick-and-dirty way to export across all Access versions =

 # Right-click on a table or a query
 # From the drop-down menu, click on *Export* 
 # Continue to select an export type (*`Save As type`* in older Access versions)
 # Make sure you specify the file name and location before you click *Save* or *Ok*
